text: The 1945 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1945 college football season. Head coach Phil Sarboe led the team to a 6–2–1 mark in the PCC and 6–2–1 overall. The season was Sarboe's first and marked the resumption of play after the conclusion of World War II. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | September 29 | Idaho | Away | 43-12 W | 9,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 6 | Oregon State | Home | 33-0 W | 9,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 13 | Washington | Away | 0-6 L | 38,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 20 | Oregon | Away | 13-26 L | 6,500 |- ! scope="row" | October 27 | Idaho | Home | 21-0 W | 5,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 3 | California | Away | 7-7 T | 40,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 10 | Oregon | Home | 20-13 W | 3,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 18 | Oregon State | Away | 13-6 W | 8,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 24 | Washington | Home | 7-0 W | 15,000 |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1945 in Washington (state)
